Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Patient ID: [REDACTED]
Date of procedure: [REDACTED]
Attending physician: Dr. J. Alvarez
Assistants: Pulmonary fellow; bronchoscopy nurse; radiology technologist.

Pre-procedure diagnosis: 25 mm solid right middle lobe lateral segment nodule in a patient with severe coronary artery disease and limited exercise tolerance.
Post-procedure diagnosis: Same.
Indication: Local tumor control for presumed stage IA lung cancer using transbronchial ablation in a poor surgical candidate.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.5 mm endotracheal tube; ASA class IV.

Procedures performed:
1. Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (Illumisite) with cone-beam CT guidance.
2. Double transbronchial microwave ablation of right middle lobe nodule using Emprint catheter.

Procedure description: After induction and intubation, the navigation bronchoscope was advanced along the pre-planned pathway to the lateral segment. Illumisite-based fluoroscopic navigation and tomosynthesis correction were used to align the extended working channel with the lesion. A CrossCountry needle was deployed and the tract dilated. The Emprint catheter was advanced and an initial 10-minute ablation was performed. Cone-beam CT showed adequate ablation but only a 3 mm minimal margin on the medial aspect. The catheter and extended working channel were repositioned slightly medial, and a second 8-minute ablation was delivered. Repeat cone-beam CT demonstrated a fused ablation zone with a minimal margin of approximately 6 mm circumferentially. Airways remained patent on inspection.

Estimated blood loss: <10 mL.
Complications: None immediate.
Disposition: Extubated in the operating room and admitted overnight for cardiac monitoring; discharge planned on post-procedure day 1 with follow-up CT at 3 months.
